places.name: Intramuros
places.description: A historic walled city that served as the center of Spanish colonial rule in the Philippines. It features old churches, museums, and cobblestone streets.

places.name: Rizal Park
places.description: A sprawling urban park dedicated to the national hero, Dr. José Rizal. It is a popular spot for relaxation and historical appreciation.

places.name: Manila Ocean Park
places.description: A marine-themed park featuring aquariums, oceanariums, and live animal shows.

places.name: National Museum of the Philippines
places.address: Padre Burgos Ave, Ermita, Manila, Philippines
places.description: A museum showcasing Philippine history, culture, and art, including the famous 'Spoliarium' by Juan Luna.

places.name: Binondo (Chinatown)
places.description: The world's oldest Chinatown, known for its rich cultural heritage and delicious Chinese-Filipino cuisine.

places.name: Fort Santiago
places.description: A historical fortress that played a significant role in Philippine history, particularly during Spanish colonization.

places.name: Manila Cathedral
places.description: A majestic Roman Catholic cathedral that has withstood wars and natural disasters, serving as a symbol of faith and resilience.

places.name: Divisoria Market
places.description: A bustling shopping district famous for its affordable goods, from textiles to electronics.
